channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report E-2023100949
item.description:
Report E-2023100949

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-01
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/01/2023, at 0431 hours, personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard discovered SHQX 51000, a residue tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gases, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Maryland Department of the Environment were notified. Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the B-End liquid valve and vapor valve partially open and the secondary closure plugs improperly installed resulting in an active release of lading. The issues were identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Derek Campbell of Kiros Energy, phone 403.483.1250. Contractor personnel closed both open valves and properly installed the secondary closure plugs in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 119 NARRI: 90

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet with one container leaking it's contents due to a loose fitted lid. DescribePack: The Lid on the gallon container was loose fitting DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Items were placed in a lined red tote for processing

item.title: Report X-2023101252
item.description:
Report X-2023101252

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: UPPER MARLBORO
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to the QA cage from unload area placed inside a tote box because the drum was crushed by the side and the content spilled in the box and tote. package handlers need more orientation about proper handling of hazmat packages generally. DescribePack: The packing box was not strong enough. The drum got split by the side while package handler was attempting to lift. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside a tote box
